file_content.text: If you're sticking around, there's plenty of cleanup to do. Wouldn't mind a hand.
Are you real?
I sense no illusion.
Identity confirmed.
Ha! You stink and you're bruised and you're real!
The Dread Masters showed us your death. They wanted our despair. I didn't know what to believe, but these soldiers--they knew the truth.
Yeah, well, it was hope for the best or start digging our own graves. It's good to see you.
I'm glad you're alright, Sergeant--and I'm glad I made it back. How are things?
Good to see you, too, Trila.
For one thing, trance time is over.
Master? I saw your distress call--it's what brought me to Oricon.
Welcome back, Master Jedi.
Ogan-Dei. It's my great honor.
The Dread Masters have been a thorn in my side awhile, and this world is a death trap. Are we done here?
That better be the end.
We could use help with the cleanup, but I won't blame you if you've got a war to fight....
Unidentified life form approaching.
They're gone. And I remember now... not being afraid.
Weapons ready!
My death never came. I am nothing.
You're Lord Calphayus, aren't you? How did you survive? Why are you here?
You're a Dread Master....
I was cold, and there was light.
Everyone, calm down. Why don't you rest, we'll see to your wounds, and we can talk.
It's okay--we won't hurt you.
Why would you do this?
I could have sworn I'd killed you back there. This time, I'll make sure it takes.
You survived. It won't last.
The fear gave us rage. The pain gave us strength. We were chained to one another, enslaved with higher purpose.
How can a man walk without chains to uplift him? How do you endure?
I don't think this man is any threat.
You don't know what he did to us.
I had a wife, once. I didn't fear her.
Take him out, now!
Look at him. Look in his eyes, and tell me he's not lost and scared and looking for hope. Tell me he deserves to die.
He's broken. Don't be afraid.
After everything that happened?
For all their bluster, the Dread Masters were still human. Now this man has another chance.
I'll make sure he's cared for and evaluated by the Jedi. Anything else can wait.
And that's how the nightmare ends, huh?
He deserves death. [Kill Calphayus]
Broken or not, the crimes he committed can't be forgiven--and he's too powerful to live.
Then the Masters' legacy of fear endures.
The Empire turns men into monsters. Monsters have to be hunted.
We're grateful for everything--the nightmare you saved us from... we won't forget it.
Messenger module update: Receiving battlefront reports.
Guess it's back to work. We'll handle the loose ends, you go be a hero.
You survived against extraordinary odds and opened the enemy's fortress. I'm not the one who's a hero.
You're all heroes here.
Looks like they've opened the palace. You'll do good in there.
The way is open. Go ahead inside, and let the Dread Masters know we're here.
Enemy launch scuttled. Pompous Dread Guard never had a chance, did they?
Hell of a fight, Master Jedi. Enemy launch scuttled.
Now you're showing off, Major. Enemy launch scuttled.
For a civilian, you do good, Captain. Enemy launch scuttled.
Our forces were able to secure a path to the Dread Masters' fortress. The gate codes are functioning.
Then it's time?
Almost. Before you go in, I need authorization for something. I've messed up--a couple times--and if I go crazy when you need support....
I've strapped on a shock collar. Next time I look unstable, I want the droid here to put me down and take full command.
Listen, Sergeant--our enemy's power comes from fear. If you don't show you're confident, how can anyone here hold it together?
You can't give up now.
I'm not--this isn't easy. But I'm not letting this mission fail because of me!
Then you need resolve. You need to know why you're fighting.
Yes. Yes, sir.
It's not a bad precaution, and I'm guessing your droid isn't afraid of much. Are you?
Sounds like a solid plan.
Extremely little, sir.
Okay. We're holding a speeder route open--that's taking most of our manpower, so once you're inside the fortress, it's up to you.
Not to put on the pressure, but--if we don't take out the Dread Masters today, we lose this sector. And we're all dead.
Death will claim you regardless.
It is time you understood true fear.
Time you faced oblivion. Come.
I saved these people. I stopped your launch. I'm not the one who should be afraid.
We'll see about that.
There's still time to stop this. Walk out of that fortress and no one has to suffer. You know you can't win.
One more chance: Surrender.
I think you're too late. By a few decades.
Or centuries.
Show them how the Republic treats tyrants, sir.
Watch my flank. I'll see you when I get back.
Hold the line, Sergeant.
My team will be here for you. Until the end.
Jedi module expression: May the Force be with you.
Radiation signatures detected. The Dread Masters' weapons are being loaded, and ships are readying for launch.
On Ord Mantell, soldiers in the thrall of hallucinogens shall slaughter refugees. After that, the chaos will be unstoppable.
Spores will grow in the air filters of Carrick Station. Murder, madness and death will follow.
My machine-arms will burrow into the soil of Alderaan and drag palaces underground.
Even if you slay our servants, we will simply launch another day.
Hunt. Kill.
Enemy reinforcements are approaching your position. However--we are opening a path to the fortress gates.
The remaining ships should not pose a significant threat. I have sent a signal for the Republic to intercept.
The Dread Masters' assault is over. We're ready to counterattack. See you soon.
Go. Don't let those ships launch.
Slicer module query: Have you obtained the computer core?
I've got it. It should let us into the Dread Masters' fortress--unless they've changed the gate codes.
Unlikely at this point--though our window of opportunity is narrow.
We have suffered additional damage since your departure. One Jedi Master and three soldiers have been rendered comatose.
Sergeant Trila threatened to fire upon our troops while hallucinating, but appears to have regained clarity.
...Yeah.
We've got bigger problems.
I know it's hard to shake them off, but you can't let the Masters win. Do you need me to stay here?
Any way I can help?
No. Your mission's more important.
Resisting the urge to kill your own people isn't the low bar for command. Find someone to take over, and fast.
You're not fit for leadership.
Recommendation noted.
Picking up launch signals near the fortress.
The Dread Masters are prepping to send tech and bioweapons to population centers. They're launching ships to slaughter the galaxy.
Go. Stop them. Meantime, we'll get those fortress gates open.
I can approximate a location.
I would expect the Dread Masters to send key lieutenants to oversee the launch. Given their tendency to "modify" their servants, I advise extreme caution.
We'll be okay. Get to the watchtower. Get that computer core.
You've done well, my friend. Their power to cast fear... not gone, but diminished.
We aren't done "diminishing" them, either.
Looking good, people. You just bought us a tonne of space to maneuver.
Looks like it's a good day for Jedi all around. You just bought us a tonne of space to maneuver.
Major! You ask me, Havoc Squad can tag along on all our ops.
Hey, Captain! You ever kick a nightmare's butt before? You're doing pretty good.
Everything secure here?
We're about ready to hit the fortress. Still need one thing, though.
Fear.
Ah!
I'm sorry. I'm so sorry for the mess. Sorry about the speeder. I miss you... I'll kill you, I swear.
Stay focused, Sergeant. What you're seeing isn't real. Come back to us. Help us stop these people.
Calm down--it's okay.
I don't want to....
Enough hiding! Enough whispering from the shadows. If you want to meet, name the place.
Face me, Dread Masters!
Guess... guess it's back to "Plan A": attacking the fortress.
Now is not the time to snivel. You said we needed one more thing before moving on the fortress--what is it?
Snap out of it, Sergeant.
Sergeant Trila?
It's okay. I'm okay. You need to hit the outer watchtower. We spotted it in the crash.
It's a link to the fortress--best guess, that's where we can get the gate codes. Only way we get inside without ordnance.
The Dread Masters use a combination of ancient Sith, Rakata, and Gree technologies. The watchtower computer core should hold the fortress gate codes, but accessing it may prove difficult.
I've dealt with ancient tech before. Just be ready when I get back--we can't afford to wait much longer.
It's not the wait that's driving us crazy. Go.
Getting some readings... what is that stuff? There's chemicals in the air, electromagnetic radiation...
Neurobiologist module analysis: Bioformed specimens increase mental suggestibility and heighten flight response.
Yes. The very land instills fear.
Atmospheric readings are improving. Whatever you're doing, keep doing it.
The legacy of Dread Master Styrak. He has earned his peace.
Every planet. Every living creature. Sculpted to fear.
Breathe deep as you destroy. The seeds will be inside you.
I think--I think my head's a little clearer now. I think you did good.
So much beauty. So peaceful.
Geo-scanning module analysis: Attempting to track subsurface movements. Those creatures are burrowing from a nearby location.
My finest creation. One hundred can burrow and infest a planet.
The ancient Sith had beasts. I have made perfection.
Let it find you. The fear will pass as darkness comes.
Demolitionist module update: The central device is now vulnerable!
The power source has gone offline. This section of the fortress defenses has been negated.
Check out those energy readings. Whatever they are, they've got to be linked to the Dread Masters' fortress.
Did everyone get back to camp?
Yeah, and they brought stragglers. Some of them are in rough shape--not just casualties, but really out of it.
Private Krieger can't stop shaking. Gialto thinks he shot his husband. This Dread Master stuff, man....
Physical or not, a wound is a wound. Get them off the battlefield, a few at a time. Use my ship if you have to.
We need to evacuate them.
Appreciate it, sir.
I don't care what they saw--if they can pull a trigger, they can fight. Just don't put them in command.
Get them in fighting shape.
Yes, sir.
Warlord module update: We will now be overrun by Dread Guard in two hours, one minute.
Well, that's an improvement. So--we're dead if we stick around, dead if we try a full withdrawal. Best bet is finish the mission.
But the Dread Masters are in a fortress under heavy guard--sent a recon party, didn't make it within a klick before we lost contact.
So let's deal with the defenses. What do we know?
Scans of this area are distorted, but we have located two high-power signatures. Exact source unknown. Likely hostile.
Okay. If you can scout those out, neutralize the threats, maybe we can move on the fortress without getting killed.
We'll prep for assault and stay on the comm. You need us, well... we'll do what we can.
Rescue module update: We are attempting to alert all survivors to your actions. Hope is on the way.
Be careful--a lot of them don't know what's real and what's not. Just... go gentle.
You rescue broken men. When they snap, they will take others with them.
How many will you gather? How many will you send to their deaths?
In oblivion, they would find salvation. You extend their pain.
You have not learned fear. Not yet. But you will.
Birth. Pain. Fear. Death.
That's everyone in range. They'd be dead without you, so thanks; now get back here.
You want to hit the Dread Masters? You want to get off this rock? Find our people and regroup here!
Don't move! Identify yourself!
The Supreme Chancellor sent me. I'm on a rescue mission.
You see salvation, when in reality, an enemy comes.
Your eyes lie. Fire. Kill.
Shut up! Dee-Ex, I need confirmation!
Identities confirmed. They are authorized agents of the Republic military.
Identity confirmed. Her Republic security clearance supersedes my own.
Identity confirmed. His Republic security clearance supersedes my own.
It's a blasted start. Sergeant Trila. I'm the highest ranking person on Oricon who's not dead, insane or in a trance.
I saw the last message from your fleet. What's happened since then?
Bring me up to speed.
That wasn't just you--I heard those voices. The Dread Masters?
Were those the Dread Masters?
They talk a lot. They make us see things. Master Ogan-Dei and the others are trying to shield us.
If those are your standards, we really are in trouble. What happened to your Jedi?
That's not very promising.
When we hit ground, Master Ogan-Dei... he and the other Jedi are trying to shield us from the Dread Masters.
I was on Belsavis when they escaped. The visions, the voices... they were never this bad before.
Warlord module update: We will be overrun by Dread Guard within eighty-nine minutes.
I'd rather hit the Sith now.
Damn it. I'd love to talk strategy, but we've got our hands full and no manpower. You all they sent?
There's no one else coming. Are there other survivors?
We think so, but they're lost in the kill zone. You find them, maybe--maybe--we can regroup, plan a counterattack.
All right. I want you to keep this place and these people safe. I'm going to look for your comrades.
Hold the fort. I'll be back.
Transmitting crash locations.
Watch your back out there. I don't know how much is real, but... those things we're fighting are bad.
Your people need evacuation, not a battle strategy.
You're in no shape to fight.
I doubt anyone would complain about an evac. But until we've got breathing room, any retreat would be a slaughter.
Find our people out there--and be careful. Transmitting crash coordinates.
You don't make a bad distraction. Maybe I'll hit the Dread Masters now while you keep their army occupied....
Maybe I should attack now.
You're a piece of work, aren't you?
Analysis suggests that penetration of the Dread Masters' fortress is best accomplished with full military backup.
He's right. I want them as dead as you do, but you won't get in without us.
Transmitting coordinates of crash locations. And if you won't help, get out of my way.
Stay alert. It's not safe here--not even close.
Yeah, well... I wish more of us were around to hear that.
After what you've been through, don't be afraid to take a breath. You all did extraordinary things; you deserve time to heal.
Your team deserves a rest.
I'll keep it in mind, Master Jedi. It's still up to our superiors.
You kept the task force together under impossible circumstances. There should be a medal in that--but don't take it personally if they promote you.
You did good, Sergeant.
Just left an opening for Havoc to save the day, sir.
You had some bad moments out there, but we came out ahead. Keep that in mind when things look bad.
You did good, kid.
You don't worry much, do you, Captain?
Everything you've seen today was the work of people--not myths or spirits. Remember that next time you face the enemy.
Remember: Never fear our foe.
Yes, sir. Never was much afraid of people.
But for what it's worth? Whatever you're off to next, we'll remember you. Stay safe.
I don't ever want to hear the words "Dread Masters" again. Don't make me burn this moon to dust.
This had better be the end.
Anyone tries to pick up where the Masters left off, I'll be right there with the detonite.
But between you and me--what's left to fear?
